definition: to ally/to unite/to join/(poetry) antithetical couplet
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])

sentences.english: I have a new dress for my birthday pary.
sentences.chinese: 我有一個生日聯歡會的新連衣裙。

sentences.english: There is going to be a get-together at the playground tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 明天將在操場上舉行聯歡會。

sentences.english: But also to be held tomorrow in the class get-together, there will be more exciting.
sentences.chinese: 明天在班裏還要舉行聯歡會，會有更精彩的表現。

sentences.english: Wing tiger group in the warm atmosphere of bayi party held in.
sentences.chinese: 翼虎團八一聯歡會在熱烈的氛圍中舉行。

sentences.english: Now integration get-togethers usually consider mixed drama singing as a fixed programme.
sentences.chinese: 聯歡會經常會把戲曲聯唱節目作爲一個固定的節目。

sentences.english: It's next to impossible to catch a taxi at night during the year- end party season.
sentences.chinese: 聯歡會季節，晚上是幾乎不可能叫到計程車的。

sentences.english: We wonder whether you would be willing to attend our end-of-the-year party.
sentences.chinese: 不知道您能否賞光，參加我們的年終聯歡會。

sentences.english: I make many new friends at the get-together.
sentences.chinese: 我在聯歡會上交了許多新朋友。

sentences.english: At the get-together, several boys in our class performed a group crosstalk.
sentences.chinese: 聯歡會上，我們班的幾個男生說了一段羣口相聲。

sentences.english: Party in a cheerful sound of gongs and drums kicked off.
sentences.chinese: 聯歡會在一片歡快的鑼鼓聲中拉開序幕。

sentences.english: At 9:00, we'll take them to the conference room, where a get-together will be held.
sentences.chinese: 點鐘，我們將帶他們到會議室舉行一個聯歡會。

sentences.english: We wish you had come to our New Year’s party.
sentences.chinese: 我們真希望你來參加了我們的新年聯歡會。

sentences.english: She sang a song at the party, greeted by loud cheers from her friends.
sentences.chinese: 聯歡會上她放歌一曲，引起朋友們一片歡呼。

sentences.english: During the get-together, it was filled with joyful laughter and songs. Every one had a good time.
sentences.chinese: 聯歡會上一片歡歌笑語，大家都玩得很開心。

sentences.english: They went to their school to attend a get-together.
sentences.chinese: 去學校參加聯歡會去了。

sentences.english: We had a get-together with many old friends.
sentences.chinese: 我們還和很多老朋友一起搞了個聯歡會。

definition: to deliver (a diploma, licence etc)/to qualify
member of a board of directors
CCTV New Year's Gala, Chinese New Year special/abbr. to 春晚[Chun1 Wan3]
pinyin: Chun1 jie2 Lian2 huan1 Wan3 hui4

definition: to gather happily under one roof
Nanzi or Nantzu district of Kaohsiung city 高雄市[Gao1 xiong2 shi4], south Taiwan
organizing committee/abbr. to 組委|组委
